To determine activation status of the IL-2R - associated ( Jak / STAT ) pathway in the HTLV-I infected cells , we examined tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and STAT5 in several HTLV-I ( + ) T-cell lines and in uncultured leukemic T cells isolated from patients with adult T-cell lymphoma / leukemia ( ATLL ) .

Constitutive basal phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and , usually , <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and STAT5 was detected in all four <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent cell lines tested , but in none of the three <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent cell lines .

Similarly , there was no detectable basal phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and STAT5 in the leukemic cells from ATLL patients ( 0 / 8 and 0 / 3 , respectively ) .

However , stimulation with <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> resulted in <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and STAT5 phosphorylation in both leukemic ATLL cells and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent lines .

We conclude that ( 1 ) HTLV-I infection per se does not result in a constitutive phosphorylation of the <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and STAT5 proteins ; ( 2 ) malignant transformation in at least some cases of ATLL does not require the constitutive , but may require <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced , activation of the IL-2R Jak / STAT pathway ; and ( 3 ) there are major differences in T-cell immortalization mechanism ( s ) which appear to involve <extra_id_0> SHP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and target molecules for rapamycin and RAD .
